Event.name: Treating_and_mistreating
Event.definition:
<def-root>In this frame an <fen>Agent</fen> is evaluated as behaving toward an <fen>Affected_Party</fen> in some <fen>Manner</fen>, which may or may not be incorporated into the target LU.
<ex><fex name="Agent">Douglas</fex> always <t>treated</t> <fex name="Affected_Party">Mary</fex> <fex name="Manner">well</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Agent
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE marks expressions that denote the person whose conduct is being evaluated.
<ex><fex name="Agent">Douglas</fex> always <t>treated</t> Mary well.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE marks expressions that characterize the way that the <fen>Agent</fen> behaves toward the <fen>Affected_Party</fen>. In the case of mistreat.v, this FE is incorporated.
<ex>Douglas always <t>treated</t> Mary <fex name="Manner">well</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE marks expressions that indicate a set of <fen>Circumstances</fen> under which the <fen>Agent</fen> acts in a particular way.
<ex><fex name="Circumstances">When Douglas was in a good mood</fex> he would never <t>mistreat</t> us.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Affected_party
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The person to whom behavior is directed by the <fen>Agent</fen>.
<ex>Douglas always <t>treated</t> <fex name="Affected_party">Mary</fex> well.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE marks expressions that indicate why an <fen>Agent</fen> behaved in a certain way.
<ex>Douglas <t>treats</t> his wife well <fex name="Explanation">because he loves her</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> behaves in a certain way.
<ex><fex name="Agent">Douglas</fex> <fex name="Manner">ill</fex>-<t>uses</t> <fex name="Affected_Party">us</fex> <fex name="Time">every week</fex> after his son visits.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The location at which the <fen>Agent</fen> exhibits their behavior.
<ex>Douglas <t>mistreated</t> me <fex name="Place">in the office</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The way in which the treating or mistreating is done.
<ex>Douglas <t>mistreats</t> waiters <fex name="Means">by yelling at them</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Domain
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Domain</fen> of human behavior in which the <fen>Agent</fen> acts in a certain <fen>Manner</fen>.
<ex>Douglas rarely <fex name="Domain">economically</fex> <t>mistreated</t> us but often verbally mistreated us instead.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The extent to which the (usually 'good' or 'bad') conduct of the <fen>Agent</fen> deviates from some standard or norm.
<ex>Douglas always <t>treated</t> me <fex name="Degree">very</fex> <fex name="Manner">well</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Standard
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An explicit point to which the conduct of the <fen>Agent</fen> is compared.
<ex>He <t>treated</t> us well <fex name="Standard">for a teenager</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: treat.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: To behave toward someone in some manner.

lexUnit.name: mistreat.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: To behave toward someone in some manner other than the way that person desires or expects to be treated.

lexUnit.name: use.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: To behave toward someone in a negative fashion further described by a required, instantiated manner. (Archaic)
